White', 'Anna Zielinski', 'Elizabeth Travis'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Sorbo', 'Shane Harper', 'David A.R. White'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
Review Text: Loved it!  I am a movie lover of all types of movies and I loved this.  I have watched lots of Christian movies but this one may be there very best.  I learned a lot and I was surprised as the movie went on.  Some Christian movies don't have big budgets and some have totally expected endings but this one was different.  The acting was great and I was very impressed with Kevin Sorbo's performance.  I can't wait to watch it again to see what I missed the first time.  I would definitely recommend!
Review Title: Awesome movie!  Can't wait to watch again.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: I enjoyed the first part of the show but the amount of F Bombs was ridiculous!  Even some of the toughest R rated movies I have seen had less bad language.  I really thought it was a joke at first.  Once we got to the end, I thought it was just plan evil.  Lots of reviews give spoilers about this so I am not giving too much away but the creature at the end just looks evil.  I won't watch again.
Review Title: Not a great show and the language was ridiculous!

Product Description: ["A dozen different souls—all moving in different directions, all longing for something more. As their lives unexpectedly intersect, they each are about to discover there is power in the Cross of Christ…even if they don't yet believe it. When a local pastor is shaken to the core by the visible faith of an old street-corner preacher, he is reminded that true belief always requires action. His response ignites a faith-fueled journey that powerfully impacts everyone it touches in ways that only God could orchestrate. I am Christian and it had those elements but it was a great a story and the faith element was a bonus. So nice to see a clean and very entertaining movie. Give it a try!

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for high-quality cinematic experiences, often gravitating towards faith-based and family-friendly films, as indicated by consistently high ratings (average 4.8) for such genres. They value well-crafted storytelling and strong performances, especially appreciating actors known for their roles in Christian films, suggesting a preference for meaningful content over blockbuster productions. Language and content sensitivity is evident; the person dislikes excessive foul language and sexual content, influencing their ratings significantly, as seen with low ratings for movies that fail to align with their moral standards. Price sensitivity appears minimal since the individual invests in a range of films without evident budget constraints, opting for content that delivers emotional depth and spiritual resonance. They typically engage with titles that offer subtitles in multiple languages, indicating inclusivity in viewing experiences. Overall, their core preferences center around impactful narratives with ethical themes and robust acting, while avoiding films with overtly graphic or offensive material.

target_interaction.title: Not as good as it could have been.
target_interaction.text: Not crazy about this one.  I really like this type of movie but it was a little slow and the actors weren't well cast. True story.
